text: The Steelfist of the Baersonling is as gigantic as he is mighty, a warrior of rarely seen quality.
As the Northern Warlord, Einarr's authority on the battlefield is unmatched. His presence inspires troops to fight with heightened morale and effectiveness during campaigns and battles.
Einarr's Norse Diplomatic Acumen improves diplomatic relations with other Norscan tribes, making alliances and trade agreements more attainable.
Known for his resilience in the harsh North, Einarr's Northern Resilience reduces attrition and enhances the survival capabilities of his armies in cold climates.

Einarr enters the Berserker's Frenzy, an unstoppable melee rampage where his attacks become more ferocious and deadly. In this state, he disregards defense, focusing solely on dealing devastating blows to his adversaries.
Einarr taps into his Berserker Rage during battle, increasing his own combat prowess and that of nearby allies, turning the tide in close-quarters engagements.
Einarr employs Viking Raider Tactics, allowing his armies to conduct swift and devastating raids on coastal settlements, disrupting enemy economies and bolstering his own treasury.
Einarr's Baersonling heritage unlocks unique recruitment options for Norscan units, instilling a sense of cultural pride and loyalty within his army.
Einarr's Glacial Battlefield Tactician skill provides strategic advantages in frozen landscapes, granting his armies enhanced movement and effectiveness in icy terrains.
You should have known antagonists never end up well..

Wielding the honor-laden title of Jarl of Vinnskor and standing proudly among the Baersonlings, Tulkir bears the weight of three decades of relentless battle on his broad shoulders. At his side, a once-magnificent blade known as Fangwyrm, now halved in valor, narrates tales of the Jarl's unyielding resilience. This magnificent weapon, snapped to less than half its former glory in the clash against the bloodbeast of the Aeslings, found renewed purpose as Einarr Sigdansson, a mighty Champion among the Baersonlings, reforged it. Despite its fracture, Fangwyrm remains a symbol of Tulkir's enduring strength and the sacrifices made in the relentless pursuit of honor and victory.
A fierce Baersonling of the fallen village of Vinnskor and a mighty Champion of Tzeentch, Einarr Steelfist was marked by the Raven God when he slew a mighty Bloodbeast.
